Crime_Name: Judicial Review of Refugee Hearing Procedures
Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration and Refugee Board violated s. 69(2) of the Immigration Act by excluding the applicant from her children's testimony
Decision_Outcome: The exclusion breached s. 69(2); matter remitted for redetermination
Legal_Rule: Section 69(2) mandates that proceedings must be held in the presence of the person involved, wherever practicable
Procedural_Issue: Exclusion of applicant during children's testimony
Grounds_for_Claim: Violation of statutory procedural fairness under s. 69(2)
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Failure to justify exclusion; alternative measures available
Legal_Framework: Statutory interpretation of s. 69(2), Immigration Act
Applicant_Challenge: Exclusion from hearing during children's testimony
Court_Result: Remitted for redetermination by a different panel
Jurisdiction: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
